se.lypson.common.gui.graphics
Class ListBox

java.lang.Object
  se.lypson.common.gui.graphics.RectangularComponent
      se.lypson.common.gui.graphics.ListBox

public class ListBox
extends RectangularComponent

A class for drawing a listbox with items. One item in the listbox can be selected. When an item in the list box is selected, it is drawn with highlighted colors when the rest of the list is drawn in neutral colors and in neutral colors when the rest of the list is drawn in highlighted colors.

Author:
Tobias Persson

removeSelectedItemChangedObserver

public void removeSelectedItemChangedObserver(ISelectedItemChangedObserver observer)
Removes an observer from the list of observers to be notified when the selected item changes.

Parameters:
observer - the observer to remove.

getPreferedWidth

public int getPreferedWidth()
Gets the prefered width of the listbox. The prefered width is the width that allows all items to be displayed fully, with space left for padding and scrollbar.

Returns:
The prefered width of the listbox.

getPreferedHeight

public int getPreferedHeight()
Gets the prefered height of the listbox. The prefered height is the height that allows exactly PREFERED_VISIBLE_ITEMS_COUNT items to be displayed simultaneously.

Returns:
The prefered height of the listbox.

draw

public void draw(javax.microedition.lcdui.Graphics graphics,
                 boolean highlighted)
Draws the listbox.

Specified by:
draw in class RectangularComponent
Parameters:
graphics - the Graphics instance to draw the listbox with.
highlighted - true to draw the listbox in a highlighted state, using highlighted colors; false to draw the listbox in a neutral state.

getSelectedItemIndex

public int getSelectedItemIndex()
Gets the index of the selected item.

Returns:
The index of the selected item; or NO_SELECTED_ITEM_INDEX if no item is selected.

getSelectedItem

public java.lang.Object getSelectedItem()
Gets the selected item.

Returns:
The selected item; or null if no item is selected.

setSelectedItemIndex

public void setSelectedItemIndex(int selectedItemIndex)
Sets the index of the selected item. If the selected item changes, the selected item changed event is raised.

Parameters:
selectedItemIndex - the index of the new selected item.

setSelectedItem

public void setSelectedItem(java.lang.Object selectedItem)
Sets the selected item.

Parameters:
selectedItem - the new selected item - one of the items already displayed in the listbox.

canScroll

public boolean canScroll(int direction)
Test if the list can scroll in a specified direction.

Parameters:
direction - the direction to scroll in - either Canvas.UP or Canvas.DOWN
Returns:
true if the list can scroll in the specified direction; otherwise, false.

Scrolls the list in a specified direction.
